_header: Well worth the sufferance that abates strife
_description: ‘And wo worthe the hastinesce þat reues man his lif’ — a couplet in Nicolas Bozon’s Contes moralisés

BLAdd46919.Transcription: Wel worth the suffrance þat abatis strifand wo worthe the hastinesce þat reues man his lif
BLAdd46919.Note: Written as prose; introduced by “Anglice” in margin.

BLHar1288.Transcription:
Well worthe suffrawns þat abatyth stryfeAnd who worthe hastyness
                    þat reuyth manys lyfe

GraysInn12.Transcription:
Wel wurch suffraunce þat abatez strif& wo wurch hastinesce
                    þat reues man his lif
GraysInn12.Note: Written as prose six lines from bottom.
